steps.name: Welcome to North Slope
steps.body:
You will need to do the following in order to set up the General NOAA Operational Modeling Environment for North Slope :

  1. Set the model run parameters.
  2. Set the flow speeds for the coastal rivers.
  3. Input the wind conditions.

steps.title: Caveat and Explanation
steps.body:
At the present time, this location file does not simulate break-up, freeze-up, or periods with significant rain or ice.

We suggest that you use this location file only during ice-free conditions, which generally occur during July and August.
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>

steps.title: Model Settings
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>

steps.title: Setting River Flow Speeds
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
steps.body:
The Sagavanirktok (Sag) River and numerous other rivers in this region flow into Stefansson Sound. In this location file, we simulate the Sag, Shaviovik, Canning, and Tamayariak Rivers explicitly.

Please set a surface current speed for each of the four rivers.

steps.title: Setting River Flow Rates
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
steps.body: The Colville River flows into Harrison Bay and the Kuparuk River flows into Gwydyr . You can choose a climatological estimate for each river or enter your own value for the Kuparuk River.

steps.title: Setting River Flow Rate
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
steps.body: The Mackenzie River flows into the Beaufort Sea. You can choose a climatological estimate for the Mackenzie River or enter your own value.

steps.title: Wind Type
steps.buttons: <button type='button' class='cancel' data-dismiss='modal'>Cancel</button><button type='button' class='back'>Back</button><button type='button' class='next'>Next</button>
steps.body:
Wind can significantly influence oil movement and can force oil to move in a different direction from the currents.

You can choose wind that is constant in direction and speed for the entire model run, or you can choose wind that varies in direction and/or speed over time.
